  • Field Details

    • BAD_VERSION

      public static final double BAD_VERSION
      The value returned by getVersionNumber() if Cancel pressed or an empty string was returned The value shall be 0xBAD.C0FFEE (2989.12648430)
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • isBadVersion

      public static boolean isBadVersion(double version)
      A quick method to see if a version is bad. We need this because floating point can round off in nasty ways
      Parameters:
      version - the version to check
      Returns:
      true if the version is bad, otherwise false

    • keyValuePair

      public static String[] keyValuePair(String keyValue)
      Convenience helper - splits a key/value string like "Rooms: R17" into a String array containing "Rooms" and "R17". All string returned will be trimmed of leading and trailing spaces
      Parameters:
      keyValue - a single string representation of a key/value pair, with the key and value separated by a colon ':' character.
      Returns:
      String[] containing

    • keyValuePair

      public static String[] keyValuePair(String keyValues, String sep)
      Convenience helper - splits a key/values string like "Rooms: R1 R2" into a String array containing Room and all the values following it. Multiple values are separated from each other with characters. All string returned will be trimmed of leading and trailing spaces
      Parameters:
      keyValues - a single string representation of a key/values pair
      sep - the separator between consecutive values. Cannot be a colon ":" or comma ","
      Returns:
      String[] containing

    • getLine

      public static String getLine(BufferedReader br, boolean sneakPeek)
      Convenience helper method to read the next non-blank, non-comment string from the reader and return trimmed string.
      Parameters:
      br - an already opened BufferedReader
      sneakPeek - true to peek ahead at the next line without removing it, so it can be read again later
      Returns:
      the next valid line of text, or null if no characters were read

    • getLine

      public static String getLine(BufferedReader br)
      Convenience helper method to read the next non-blank, non-comment string from the reader and return trimmed string.
      Parameters:
      br - an already opened BufferedReader
      Returns:
      the next string in the stream, or null if no characters were read

    • toInt

      public static int toInt(String str, String errMessageOnFailure) throws RuntimeException
      Try to convert the input into an integer. If it can't, throw a RuntimeException with message
      Parameters:
      str - The string holding the number to be converted
      errMessageOnFailure - The string to use as the RuntimeException message
      Returns:
      the int value of str
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the number can't be converted
